Autobiographical Memory Interview - Average number of INTERNAL (Episodic) details across scenarios (6 scenarios for cohort 1; 5 scenarios for cohort 2/ageing)
Autobiographical Memory Interview - Average number of EXTERNAL (Semantic) details across scenarios (6 scenarios for cohort 1; 5 scenarios for cohort 2/ageing)
Autobiographical Memory Interview - Average number of RICHNESS across scenarios - higher scores = greater rated richness
Autobiographical Memory Interview - Average number of EVENT details across scenarios - higher scores = more event details in descriptions
Autobiographical Memory Interview - Average number of PLACE details across scenarios - higher scores = more place details in descriptions
Autobiographical Memory Interview - Average number of TEMPORAL details across scenarios - higher scores = more time details in descriptions
Autobiographical Memory Interview - Average number of PERCEPTUAL details across scenarios - higher scores = more perceptual details in descriptions
Autobiographical Memory Interview - Average number of EMOTIONAL/THOUGHT details across scenarios - higher scores = more emotional/thought details in descriptions

Autobiographical Memory Interview - Average number of EXTERNAL EVENT (i.e. details of events not relevant to scenario being described) across scenarios - higher scores = more  external event details in descriptions
Autobiographical Memory Interview - Average number of SEMANTIC (general knowledge) details across scenarios - higher scores = more semantic details in descriptions
Autobiographical Memory Interview - Average number of REPETITION across scenarios - higher scores = more repetition in descriptions
Autobiographical Memory Interview - Average number of OTHER details (things that didnt fit in coding categories across scenarios) - higher scores = more repetition in descriptions
